narration: What did God make on the very first day?

feedback: God said 'Let there be light!' on Day 1!

feedback: No! God made LIGHT on Day 1. The sun came on Day 4!

narration: Which animal did God make last of all?
question: What was the last thing God made?
feedback: God made people last â€” and they were very special!

feedback: Yes! The sky was made on Day 2!

narration: Put God's creation days in the right order!
question: Order what God made first to last
feedback: Amazing! You know the creation order!

narration: What did God make on Day 4 in the sky?
question: What did God put in the sky on Day 4?
feedback: God made the sun, moon, and stars on Day 4!

narration: God rested on Day 7. True or false?
question: God rested on Day 7
feedback: Yes! God rested on Day 7 and called it holy!

narration: God made fish and birds on Day FIVE. Tap the word FIVE.
sentence: Fish and birds were made on Day ___
feedback: Day 5 â€” fish in the sea and birds in the sky!

narration: Who made the whole world?
question: Who created everything?
feedback: God made everything â€” the whole beautiful world!

narration: What did God make on Day 3 on the ground?
question: What grew from the ground on Day 3?
feedback: Plants and trees grew on Day 3!

narration: Who built a giant boat called an ark?
question: Who built the big ark?
feedback: Noah built the ark because he trusted God!

narration: What did Noah put inside the ark?
question: What went inside Noah's ark?
feedback: Animals went inside â€” two of every kind!

narration: Noah put one of every animal in the ark. True or false?
question: Noah put ONE of every animal in the ark
feedback: Noah put TWO of every animal â€” a male and a female!

narration: After the flood, God put a RAINBOW in the sky. Tap the word RAINBOW.
sentence: God put a ___ in the sky as a promise
feedback: The rainbow is God's promise to never flood the whole earth again!

narration: What bird did Noah send out to find dry land?
question: Which bird did Noah send out?
feedback: Noah sent a dove â€” it came back with an olive leaf!

narration: Put Noah's story in the right order!
question: What happened first to last in Noah's story?
feedback: You know Noah's whole story!

narration: It rained for 40 days and 40 nights. True or false?
question: It rained for 40 days and 40 nights
feedback: Yes! It rained for 40 days and 40 nights!

narration: What is the shape of the promise God made to Noah?
question: What shape is God's promise to Noah?
feedback: A rainbow â€” God's colorful promise!

narration: Noah was a GOOD man who loved God. Tap the word GOOD.
sentence: Noah was a ___ man who listened to God
feedback: Noah was good and obedient to God!

narration: Who floated safely in the big ark with his family?
question: Whose family was safe in the ark?
feedback: Noah's whole family was safe inside the ark!

narration: Who was the baby put in a basket in the river?
question: Which baby was put in a river basket?
feedback: Baby Moses was hidden in a basket to keep him safe!

narration: Where did Moses' mother hide him?
question: Where was baby Moses hidden?
feedback: His mother made a basket to hide him in the river!

narration: Moses saw a burning bush that was not burning up. True or false?
question: The burning bush kept burning and never burned up
feedback: Yes! The bush burned but was never destroyed â€” it was a miracle!

narration: God spoke to Moses from a BURNING bush. Tap the word BURNING.
sentence: God spoke to Moses from a ___ bush
feedback: The burning bush was God calling Moses!

narration: What happened when Moses stretched his staff over the Red Sea?
question: What did the Red Sea do for Moses?
feedback: The water split apart so the people could walk through!

narration: Who was Moses' sister who watched him in the basket?
question: Who watched baby Moses in the basket?
feedback: Miriam watched over her baby brother Moses!

narration: Moses grew up as a prince in Egypt. True or false?
question: Moses grew up in a palace in Egypt
feedback: Yes! A princess found baby Moses and raised him as her own!

narration: Put Moses' story in the right order!
question: What happened first to last for Moses?
feedback: You know all about Moses!

narration: What did God give Moses on the mountain?
question: What did Moses get from God on the mountain?
feedback: The Ten Commandments â€” God's rules for living!

narration: Moses led God's people OUT of Egypt. Tap the word OUT.
sentence: Moses led God's people ___ of Egypt
feedback: Moses led the people OUT of slavery in Egypt!

narration: Who was the small boy who fought the giant?
question: Who beat the giant Goliath?
feedback: David, the brave shepherd boy, beat Goliath!

narration: What did David use to defeat the giant Goliath?
question: What did David use to beat Goliath?
feedback: One small stone from a sling â€” and the giant fell!

narration: Goliath was a very small soldier. True or false?
question: Goliath was a tiny little soldier
feedback: Goliath was GIANT â€” very, very tall and scary!

narration: David was brave because GOD was with him. Tap the word GOD.
sentence: David was not afraid because ___ was with him
feedback: God was with David â€” that's why he was so brave!

narration: What job did David have before he became king?
question: What was David's job as a boy?
feedback: David was a shepherd â€” he took care of sheep!

narration: Who was the big scary giant David fought?

question: David became the king of Israel
feedback: Yes! The shepherd boy David became a great king!

feedback: David picked 5 stones â€” but only needed one!

question: What happened first to last for David?
feedback: You know David's whole story!

question: What are David's songs called?
feedback: David's songs are in the book of Psalms!

narration: Who was thrown into a den of hungry lions?
question: Who was thrown to the lions?
feedback: Daniel was thrown into the lions' den for praying to God!

question: Why was Daniel punished?

narration: The lions hurt Daniel. True or false?

sentence: God sent an ___ to shut the lions' mouths
feedback: An angel kept Daniel safe all night!

narration: How many times a day did Daniel pray to God?
question: How many times a day did Daniel pray?
feedback: Daniel prayed to God three times every day!

narration: Daniel prayed even when it was against the rules. True or false?
question: Daniel kept praying even when it was against the law
feedback: Yes! Daniel was so brave â€” he kept praying no matter what!

narration: Daniel was found SAFE in the morning. Tap the word SAFE.
sentence: In the morning Daniel was found ___ in the den
feedback: Daniel was completely safe â€” God protected him!

narration: Who was the king who threw Daniel in the lion's den?
question: Which king gave the order to throw Daniel to the lions?
feedback: King Darius was tricked into throwing Daniel to the lions!

narration: Put Daniel's story in order!
question: What happened first to last for Daniel?
feedback: You know Daniel's whole story!

narration: What big scary animals were in the den with Daniel?
question: What animals were in the den?
feedback: Lions! But God kept them calm around Daniel!

narration: Who is the baby born in Bethlehem on Christmas?
question: Who was born in Bethlehem?
feedback: Jesus was born in Bethlehem â€” the best birthday ever!

narration: Where was baby Jesus laid to sleep?
question: Where did baby Jesus sleep?
feedback: Jesus slept in a manger â€” a box where animals eat!

narration: Jesus was born in a big palace. True or false?
question: Jesus was born in a grand palace
feedback: No! Jesus was born in a humble stable with animals!

narration: A bright STAR led the wise men to Jesus. Tap the word STAR.
sentence: A bright ___ led the wise men to baby Jesus

narration: Who came to see baby Jesus first on the night he was born?
question: Who visited baby Jesus first?
feedback: Shepherds came first â€” angels told them the good news!

question: Angels announced Jesus' birth to the shepherds
feedback: Yes! The angels said 'Good news of great joy!'

narration: Mary was Jesus' MOTHER. Tap the word MOTHER.
sentence: Mary was Jesus' ___
feedback: Mary was Jesus' loving mother!

narration: Put the Christmas story in order!
question: What happened first to last at Jesus' birth?
feedback: You know the whole Christmas story!

narration: Who was Jesus' earthly father who took care of him?
question: Who was Jesus' earthly dad?
feedback: Joseph was Jesus' loving earthly father!

narration: What gifts did the wise men bring to Jesus?
question: What did the wise men bring?
feedback: Gold, frankincense, and myrrh â€” very precious gifts!

narration: Jesus fed a huge crowd with only a little food. What was the food?
question: What food did Jesus use to feed 5000 people?
feedback: Five loaves of bread and two fish â€” and everyone had enough!

narration: Jesus walked on water. True or false?
question: Jesus walked on top of the water
feedback: Yes! Jesus walked on the water and helped Peter too!

narration: Jesus turned water into WINE at a wedding. Tap the word WINE.
sentence: Jesus turned water into ___ at the wedding
feedback: Jesus' very first miracle was at a wedding in Cana!

narration: Who walked on water toward Jesus but started to sink?
question: Which disciple tried to walk on water?
feedback: Peter stepped out of the boat but got scared and started to sink!

narration: How many people did Jesus feed with 5 loaves and 2 fish?
question: How many people did Jesus feed?
feedback: Five thousand people! And there were leftovers!

narration: Jesus healed sick people. True or false?
question: Jesus made sick people well again
feedback: Yes! Jesus healed blind people, lame people, and so many more!

narration: Jesus told the storm to be STILL and it obeyed him. Tap STILL.
sentence: Jesus said 'Be ___!' and the storm stopped
feedback: Jesus has power over the wind and waves!

question: Whose friend did Jesus raise from the dead?
feedback: Jesus called 'Lazarus, come out!' and he came out alive!

narration: Put the feeding miracle in order!
question: What happened first to last with the loaves and fish?
feedback: You know the miracle of the loaves and fish!

narration: Who had the 5 loaves and 2 fish that Jesus used?
question: Who gave Jesus the loaves and fish?
feedback: A little boy shared his lunch â€” and Jesus made it feed thousands!

narration: Jesus calls himself the Good Shepherd. Who is the Good Shepherd?
question: Who is the Good Shepherd?
feedback: Jesus said 'I am the Good Shepherd' â€” he cares for all of us!

narration: In the story, a shepherd had 100 sheep. One got lost. What did he do?
question: What did the shepherd do when one sheep was lost?
feedback: He searched and searched until he found the one lost sheep!

narration: The Good Shepherd leaves all 100 sheep to find the 1 lost one. True or false?
question: The shepherd left the 99 to find the 1 lost sheep
feedback: Yes! Every single sheep matters to the Good Shepherd!

narration: The Good Shepherd knows his sheep by NAME. Tap the word NAME.
sentence: The Good Shepherd calls his own sheep by ___
feedback: Jesus knows each one of us by name â€” just like a shepherd!

narration: How many sheep were in the shepherd's flock in the story?
question: How many sheep did the shepherd have?
feedback: 100 sheep â€” and he cared about every single one!

narration: The shepherd was happy when he found the lost sheep. True or false?
question: The shepherd was happy when he found the lost sheep
feedback: He was SO happy he called his friends to celebrate!

narration: Jesus says his sheep FOLLOW him. Tap the word FOLLOW.
sentence: Jesus' sheep hear his voice and ___ him
feedback: We follow Jesus just like sheep follow their shepherd!

narration: Put the lost sheep story in order!
question: What happened first to last in the lost sheep story?
feedback: You know the whole lost sheep story!

narration: The Good Shepherd lays down his life for his sheep. Jesus laid down his life for us. What does this show?
question: What does the Good Shepherd story show us about Jesus?

narration: Jesus said I am the door â€” if anyone enters through me they will be saved. Who said this?
question: Who said 'I am the door for the sheep'?
feedback: Jesus is the door â€” the way to be safe and saved!

narration: Who was the very first man God made?
question: Who was the first person God made?
feedback: Adam was the very first person â€” God made him from dust and breathed life into him!

narration: After creating everything, God said it was very good. True or false?
question: God looked at all he made and said it was VERY GOOD
feedback: Yes! God saw everything he made and said it was very good!

narration: God made the first man from the DUST of the ground. Tap the word DUST.
sentence: God made the first man from the ___ of the ground

question: Where did God put the first man to live?
feedback: God planted a beautiful garden full of trees for Adam to live in!

narration: What came first, second, and third in creation? Put them in order!
question: Order Day 1, Day 2, Day 3 of creation
feedback: Light on Day 1, sky on Day 2, and land and sea on Day 3!

narration: Who were Noah's three sons who went on the ark with him?
question: What were Noah's three sons called?
feedback: Shem, Ham, and Japheth â€” Noah's three sons were all on the ark!

narration: The ark had three decks â€” lower, middle, and upper. True or false?
question: The ark Noah built had three floors or decks
feedback: Yes! God told Noah to build three decks in the big ark!

narration: When the flood ended, the ark rested on Mount ARARAT. Tap the word ARARAT.

narration: After leaving the ark, Noah built an altar to worship and thank God. True or false?

items: God puts rainbow in sky ğŸŒˆ
feedback: The waters went down, the dove found land, then God made his rainbow promise!

question: Who was Moses' brother and helper?
feedback: Aaron was Moses' brother â€” he helped Moses speak to Pharaoh!

narration: God sent ten plagues on Egypt to free his people. True or false?
question: God sent TEN plagues on Egypt
feedback: Yes! Ten plagues â€” frogs, locusts, darkness and more â€” before Pharaoh let the people go!

narration: What special food did God send from the sky to feed the Israelites in the desert?

narration: Put these big events from Moses' life in order!
question: Order these events from Moses' story

feedback: Plagues on Egypt, crossing the sea, then the Ten Commandments on the mountain!

narration: David's father's name was Jesse. True or false?

narration: David had to run and hide from King SAUL. Tap the word SAUL.

question: David wrote many of the Psalms in the Bible

narration: Put these events from David's life in the right order!
question: Order these events in David's story

narration: Daniel's three friends were thrown into something very hot. What was it?
question: What were Daniel's three friends thrown into?

narration: A mysterious fourth person appeared walking in the fire with Daniel's three friends. True or false?

narration: The three friends said our God is ABLE to save us from the fire. Tap the word ABLE.

narration: Put Daniel's story in order from the beginning!
question: Order these events from Daniel's story

narration: Which angel brought the amazing news to Mary?
question: Which angel told Mary she would have Jesus?
feedback: The angel Gabriel came to Mary with the most wonderful news ever!

narration: Jesus was born in Nazareth. True or false?
question: Jesus was born in the town of Nazareth
feedback: No! Jesus was born in BETHLEHEM â€” Mary and Joseph had to travel there!

narration: The angel told Mary to name the baby JESUS. Tap the word JESUS.

feedback: Jesus! His name means God saves â€” and that is exactly what he came to do!

narration: What shone brightly in the sky to guide the wise men to Jesus?
question: What guided the wise men to find baby Jesus?
feedback: A bright star in the east led the wise men all the way to baby Jesus!

narration: Put these Christmas events in the right order!
question: Order these events from the Christmas story
feedback: Angel visits Mary, then Jesus is born, then the wise men arrive with gifts!

question: Who did Jesus raise after 4 days in the tomb?
feedback: Lazarus! Jesus called out loudly and Lazarus walked out of the tomb alive!

narration: Jesus healed a blind man by putting mud on his eyes. True or false?
question: Jesus healed a blind man using mud on his eyes

narration: Jesus told the paralyzed man to pick up his MAT and walk. Tap the word MAT.

feedback: Pick up your mat and walk! And the man got up and walked â€” healed by Jesus!

question: Order these miracles from Jesus' ministry

question: Sheep know and follow the voice of their own shepherd

narration: Jesus said I am the Good Shepherd. True or false?
question: Jesus called himself the Good Shepherd
feedback: Yes! Jesus said I am the Good Shepherd â€” he knows and loves each of his sheep!

narration: Jesus said the Good Shepherd LAYS DOWN his life for the sheep. Tap LAYS DOWN.
sentence: Jesus said the good shepherd ___ his life for the sheep
feedback: Jesus, the Good Shepherd, laid down his life because he loves us so much!

narration: What happens to a sheep that wanders away from the shepherd? Is it safe or in danger?
question: A sheep that wanders away from the shepherd is in...
feedback: Danger! A sheep without a shepherd is lost and scared â€” that's why we need Jesus!

narration: Put the Good Shepherd story in order!
question: Order the events in the Good Shepherd story
items: Shepherd finds the lost sheep ğŸ‰
feedback: 100 sheep, one gets lost, and the Good Shepherd searches until he finds it!

narration: Who was the first woman God ever made?
question: Who was the first woman?
feedback: Eve was the very first woman â€” God made her from Adam's rib!

narration: The first woman was made from Adam's rib. True or false?
question: God made the first woman from Adam's rib
feedback: Yes! God took one of Adam's ribs and made Eve â€” the first woman!

narration: What did Adam and Eve eat from the tree that God said not to touch?
question: What did Adam and Eve eat that they should not have?
feedback: They ate the fruit from the forbidden tree â€” and that changed everything!

narration: A sneaky SERPENT tricked Eve in the garden. Tap the word SERPENT.
sentence: A sneaky ___ told Eve it was okay to eat the fruit
feedback: The serpent told Eve a lie! We should always trust God and not listen to lies!

narration: The beautiful garden where Adam and Eve lived was called the Garden of Eden. True or false?
question: Adam and Eve lived in the Garden of Eden
feedback: Yes! God planted a beautiful Garden of Eden full of trees and rivers for them!

narration: Put the Garden of Eden story in order!
question: Order these events from the Garden of Eden
feedback: God made Adam, then Eve, then the serpent tricked them, and they had to leave the garden!

narration: Adam gave names to all the animals in the garden. True or false?
question: Adam named all the animals
feedback: Yes! God brought every animal to Adam and Adam gave each one a special name!

narration: The beautiful garden God made was called the Garden of EDEN. Tap EDEN.
sentence: God planted a beautiful garden called the Garden of ___
feedback: The Garden of Eden â€” the most beautiful place God ever made!

narration: How did Adam and Eve feel after they disobeyed God and had to leave the garden?
question: How did Adam and Eve feel after disobeying God?
feedback: They were sad â€” sin always brings sadness. But God still loved them and made them clothes!

narration: Who was the sneaky creature that lied to Eve in the garden?
question: Who tricked Eve with a lie in the garden?
feedback: The serpent â€” the Bible tells us it was the devil in disguise â€” told Eve a big lie!

narration: God made a special promise called a covenant with Noah after the flood. True or false?
question: God made a covenant promise with Noah
feedback: Yes! A covenant is a very serious promise â€” God promised never to flood the whole earth again!

narration: Why did God choose Noah to build the ark?
question: Why did God choose Noah?
feedback: Because Noah loved God and tried to do what was right â€” God saw Noah's good heart!

narration: God made a COVENANT with Noah. Tap the word COVENANT.
sentence: God said I will make a ___ with you and your family
feedback: A covenant is a very special promise â€” and God always keeps his promises!

narration: God told Noah to take seven pairs of clean animals into the ark. True or false?
question: God told Noah to take 7 pairs of clean animals
feedback: Yes! Clean animals got 7 pairs each â€” so there would be extras for sacrifice after the flood!

narration: The flood water covered even the highest mountains. True or false?
question: The flood water covered the highest mountains
feedback: Yes! The water rose higher than the mountains â€” only those on the ark were safe!

narration: Put these events from the flood in order!
question: Order these flood events
feedback: God warned Noah, Noah built the ark, animals came in, then the rain began!

narration: After the flood God told Noah to be FRUITFUL and fill the earth. Tap FRUITFUL.
sentence: God told Noah and his family to be ___ and fill the earth again
feedback: God told them to have children and fill the earth with people again!

narration: God promised that as long as the earth remains, seasons and harvests will never stop. True or false?
question: God promised seasons and harvests will always continue
feedback: Yes! God said seedtime and harvest, cold and heat, summer and winter will never cease!

narration: What does the rainbow sign mean for all creatures on earth?
question: The rainbow is a sign of God's...
feedback: God's covenant promise â€” like a handshake with all creation, never to flood the whole earth again!

narration: How many people were on Noah's ark altogether?
question: How many people were on Noah's ark?
feedback: 8 people! Noah, his wife, his 3 sons, and his 3 daughters-in-law â€” all safe on the ark!

narration: Who was the powerful king of Egypt who refused to let God's people go?
question: Who refused to let God's people leave Egypt?
feedback: Pharaoh was the proud king who said NO to God â€” until the plagues changed his mind!

narration: On Passover night, God told Israel to put lamb's blood on their door so the plague would pass over them. True or false?
question: Israel put lamb's blood on their doors on Passover night
feedback: Yes! The blood on the door kept them safe â€” a picture of how Jesus' blood saves us!

narration: God also sent birds for the Israelites to eat in the desert alongside the manna. What birds did he send?
question: What birds did God send for Israel to eat?
feedback: God sent quail birds â€” small birds perfect for eating â€” along with the manna!

narration: Moses struck a ROCK and water came gushing out for the thirsty people. Tap the word ROCK.
sentence: God told Moses to strike the ___ and water came pouring out
feedback: Water from a rock â€” only God can do miracles like that!

narration: The Ten Commandments were written on tablets of stone by God. True or false?
question: God wrote the Ten Commandments on stone tablets
feedback: Yes! God himself wrote the commandments on two stone tablets for Moses!

narration: Put these Exodus events in order!
question: Order these events from the Exodus journey
feedback: Passover, crossing the sea, manna in the desert, then water from a rock!

narration: The special bread God sent from the sky was called MANNA. Tap the word MANNA.
sentence: The Israelites called the special bread from heaven ___
feedback: Manna means What is it? â€” because no one had ever seen anything like it before!

narration: Moses went up Mount Sinai to receive God's law. True or false?
question: Moses went up a mountain to receive God's commandments
feedback: Yes! Moses went up Mount Sinai and met with God to receive the Ten Commandments!

narration: Who led God's people into the Promised Land after Moses died?
question: Who led Israel into the Promised Land?
feedback: Joshua was Moses' helper and became the new leader â€” he led Israel into the Promised Land!

narration: Because Israel refused to trust God, they had to wander somewhere for 40 years. Where?
question: Where did Israel wander for 40 years?
feedback: The desert! They wandered for 40 long years because they were afraid to trust God!

narration: Who was David's very best friend and the son of King Saul?
question: Who was David's best friend?
feedback: Jonathan was David's best friend â€” they loved each other like brothers!

narration: David wanted to build God's temple but God said his son Solomon would build it. True or false?
question: David wanted to build the temple but God said Solomon would build it
feedback: Yes! David had the idea and gathered materials, but God said Solomon his son would build it!

narration: When the Ark of God was brought to Jerusalem, David was so joyful he did something special. What did he do?
question: How did David celebrate when the Ark came to Jerusalem?
feedback: David danced with all his might before the Lord â€” he was filled with joy!

narration: David's most famous psalm starts with The Lord is my SHEPHERD. Tap SHEPHERD.
sentence: David wrote: The Lord is my ___; I shall not want
feedback: The Lord is my shepherd â€” Psalm 23 is one of the most beautiful songs ever written!

narration: David's son Solomon became the wisest king in the whole world. True or false?
question: Solomon, David's son, became famous for his great wisdom
feedback: Yes! God gave Solomon more wisdom than anyone â€” kings and queens came from far away to hear him!

narration: Put these events from David's later life in order!
question: Order these events from David's story
feedback: Jonathan as friend, then fleeing Saul, then becoming king, then Solomon was born!

narration: David showed kindness to Jonathan's son Mephibosheth. True or false?
question: David kept his promise to Jonathan by caring for his son
feedback: Yes! David gave Jonathan's son Mephibosheth a place at his table â€” a beautiful act of kindness!

narration: David captured JERUSALEM and made it his capital city. Tap JERUSALEM.
sentence: King David captured ___ and made it the City of David
feedback: Jerusalem â€” the City of David â€” became the most important city in Israel!

narration: What was the Ark of the Covenant â€” the special golden box David brought to Jerusalem?
question: What was kept inside the Ark of the Covenant?
feedback: The Ten Commandments on stone tablets â€” kept safe inside the golden Ark of the Covenant!

narration: David called God his rock, his fortress, and his deliverer. Who do we turn to when we are afraid?
question: Who did David call his rock and fortress?
feedback: God is our rock and fortress â€” just like David trusted him, we can trust God too!

narration: Which king had a dream about a giant statue that no one could explain â€” until Daniel came?
question: Who had a dream only Daniel could explain?
feedback: King Nebuchadnezzar had the dream â€” and only God through Daniel could explain it!

narration: God made Daniel and his friends ten times wiser than all the magicians in Babylon. True or false?
question: Daniel and friends became ten times wiser than the king's magicians
feedback: Yes! Because they trusted God and ate clean food, God blessed them with amazing wisdom!

narration: A mysterious HAND appeared and wrote on the wall at King Belshazzar's feast. Tap the word HAND.
sentence: At the king's feast a mysterious ___ appeared and wrote on the wall
feedback: A hand wrote MENE MENE TEKEL PARSIN â€” only Daniel could explain what it meant!

narration: What did Daniel and his friends ask to eat instead of the king's rich food?
question: What did Daniel ask to eat instead of the king's food?
feedback: Vegetables and water â€” and they became healthier than everyone who ate the king's food!

narration: After Daniel explained the king's dream, King Nebuchadnezzar praised God. True or false?
question: King Nebuchadnezzar praised God after Daniel explained his dream
feedback: Yes! The king said Truly your God is the God of gods and Lord of kings!

narration: Put these Daniel stories in order!
question: Order these events from Daniel's life
feedback: First the food test, then the dream, then the furnace, then the lions â€” Daniel trusted God every time!

narration: God gave Daniel the special ability to understand VISIONS and dreams. Tap VISIONS.
sentence: God gave Daniel wisdom and the ability to understand ___ and dreams
feedback: God gave Daniel the gift of understanding visions and dreams â€” a very special gift!

narration: King Nebuchadnezzar became very proud and God humbled him by making him live like an animal. True or false?
question: God humbled proud Nebuchadnezzar by making him live like an animal
feedback: Yes! He lived in the fields like an ox until he looked up to heaven and praised God!

narration: What was Daniel's greatest gift that God gave him?
question: What special gift did God give Daniel?
feedback: God gave Daniel great wisdom â€” especially the ability to understand dreams and visions!

narration: Before Daniel was thrown to the lions, a king said your God whom you serve will deliver you. Which king said this?
question: Which king said God would deliver Daniel from the lions?
feedback: King Darius said this â€” he cared about Daniel and hoped God would save him!

narration: Mary and Joseph fled to Egypt to keep baby Jesus safe from King Herod. True or false?
question: Mary and Joseph fled to Egypt to protect baby Jesus
feedback: Yes! An angel warned Joseph in a dream â€” so they escaped to Egypt until Herod died!

narration: Which evil king tried to find and harm baby Jesus?
question: Which king tried to hurt baby Jesus?
feedback: King Herod was jealous of Jesus â€” but God kept baby Jesus safe by warning Joseph!

narration: Why did Mary and Joseph have to travel all the way to Bethlehem?
question: Why did Mary and Joseph go to Bethlehem?
feedback: For a census â€” the emperor wanted to count all the people, so everyone went to their home town!

narration: An old man named Simeon held baby Jesus and said now I can go in PEACE. Tap PEACE.
sentence: Simeon said Lord now I can go in ___ for my eyes have seen the Saviour
feedback: Simeon had waited his whole life to see the Saviour â€” and God kept that promise!

narration: John the Baptist was Jesus' cousin. True or false?
question: John the Baptist was Jesus' cousin
feedback: Yes! Elizabeth, John's mum, was Mary's cousin â€” so John and Jesus were cousins!

narration: Put these events from around Jesus' birth in order!
question: Order these events from Jesus' birth story
items: John the Baptist is born ğŸ‘¶
feedback: Zechariah first, then John born, then Jesus born, then the family fled to Egypt!

narration: The angel Gabriel first visited an old priest named Zechariah before visiting Mary. True or false?
question: Gabriel visited Zechariah before he visited Mary
feedback: Yes! Gabriel told old Zechariah that his wife Elizabeth would have a son named John!

narration: Angel Gabriel said to Mary: Greetings, you who are HIGHLY FAVOURED. Tap HIGHLY FAVOURED.
sentence: Gabriel said Greetings, you who are ___, the Lord is with you
feedback: Highly favoured! Mary was chosen by God for the most amazing task in history!

narration: Who was the old prophetess who also saw baby Jesus at the temple and praised God?
question: Which elderly prophetess saw baby Jesus at the temple?
feedback: Anna the prophetess â€” she had prayed at the temple for years and God let her see the Saviour!

narration: The name Jesus means God saves. True or false?
question: The name Jesus means God saves
feedback: Yes! Jesus means God saves â€” and that is exactly what he came to earth to do!

narration: Whose daughter did Jesus bring back to life when people said she had already died?
question: Whose daughter did Jesus raise from the dead?
feedback: Jairus was a synagogue leader who begged Jesus to help â€” and Jesus raised his little girl!

narration: A woman who had been sick for twelve years was healed just by touching the edge of Jesus' cloak. True or false?
question: A woman was healed by touching the edge of Jesus' cloak
feedback: Yes! She had been sick for 12 years. One touch of Jesus' cloak and she was completely healed!

narration: Jesus took Jairus's daughter's hand and said ARISE. Tap the word ARISE.
sentence: Jesus took the little girl's hand and said ___, little girl!
feedback: Talitha kum means Arise, little girl â€” and she got up immediately!

narration: Jesus stood in the boat and said PEACE be still to the storm. Tap the word PEACE.
sentence: Jesus stood up in the boat and said ___, be still to the storm
feedback: Peace be still â€” and immediately the wind stopped and the sea was calm!

narration: Jesus healed a Roman soldier's servant without even going to the house â€” just by speaking the word. True or false?
question: Jesus healed a servant from a distance just by speaking
feedback: Yes! The Roman centurion had great faith â€” he said just say the word and my servant will be healed!

narration: Put the story of Jairus and his daughter in order!
question: Order the events in the story of Jairus
items: Jairus begs Jesus for help ğŸ™
Messenger says the girl has died ğŸ˜¢
Jesus goes to the house ğŸ
feedback: Jairus asked, bad news came, Jesus went anyway, and the girl was raised â€” amazing!

narration: Jesus healed a man who had been paralyzed and unable to walk for 38 years. True or false?
question: Jesus healed a man who had been paralyzed for 38 years
feedback: Yes! The man lay by the pool of Bethesda for 38 years and Jesus healed him instantly!

narration: A blind man named Bartimaeus shouted LORD have mercy on me. Tap the word LORD.
sentence: Blind Bartimaeus cried out ___, Son of David, have mercy on me!
feedback: Jesus heard Bartimaeus calling and healed his eyes â€” he could see for the very first time!

narration: Who was the short tax collector who climbed a tree to see Jesus and invited him to his house?
question: Who climbed a tree to see Jesus?
feedback: Zacchaeus! He was so short he climbed a sycamore tree â€” and Jesus called him down and changed his life!

narration: The Bible says the whole world could not hold all the books if every miracle Jesus did was written down. True or false?
question: There were so many miracles the world could not hold all the books about them
feedback: Yes! John 21:25 says this â€” Jesus did so many amazing things we could never count them all!

narration: Jesus said I am the LIGHT of the world. Whoever follows me will not walk in darkness. Who is the Light of the World?
question: Jesus said I am the ___ of the world. What is missing?
feedback: Jesus is the Light of the World â€” he shows us the way and takes away all darkness!

narration: In the story of the Prodigal Son, the father saw his son coming from far away and ran to meet him. True or false?
question: The father ran to meet his son who had been lost
feedback: Yes! The father ran! Just like God runs to welcome us when we come back to him!

narration: Jesus said I am the WAY the truth and the life. Tap the word WAY.
sentence: Jesus said I am the ___, the truth, and the life
feedback: Jesus is the WAY â€” the only way to God the Father!

narration: What does the Great Commandment tell us to do above everything else?
question: What is the most important commandment?
feedback: Love! Love God with all your heart â€” and love your neighbour as yourself!

narration: Jesus washed his disciples' feet to show them how to serve one another humbly. True or false?
question: Jesus washed his disciples' feet to teach them to serve others
feedback: Yes! Jesus got down and washed their feet â€” showing us that serving others is the greatest thing!

narration: Put the story of the Prodigal Son in order!
question: Order the events in the Prodigal Son story
items: Son leaves home with money ğŸ’°
Son feeds pigs and is hungry ğŸ·
feedback: He left, hit rock bottom, came back, and his father celebrated â€” just like God celebrates when we return!

narration: Jesus said I am the good shepherd and I KNOW my sheep. Tap the word KNOW.
sentence: Jesus said I am the good shepherd; I ___ my sheep and my sheep know me
feedback: Jesus knows each of us personally â€” our name, our worries, our joys â€” everything!

narration: Jesus is called both the Good Shepherd who cares for us AND the Lamb of God who saves us. True or false?
question: Jesus is both the Good Shepherd and the Lamb of God
feedback: Yes! He is our caring shepherd AND the sacrificial lamb â€” he loves us that much!

narration: When the lost sheep was found what did the shepherd do with all his friends and neighbours?
question: What did the shepherd do when the lost sheep was found?
feedback: He called all his friends to celebrate â€” there is always a party in heaven when someone is found!

narration: Jesus said to Martha I am the RESURRECTION and the life. Tap RESURRECTION.
sentence: Jesus said to Martha: I am the ___ and the life
feedback: The resurrection and the life â€” Jesus has power over death itself! That is amazing news!
